0: Authorities are investigating the death of an American woman on board a Princess Cruises ship on Tuesday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The 52-year-old woman, described only as a "female guest" on the Royal Princess from the U.S., died under unclear circumstances. The ship was on a seven-day cruise from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, to Aruba. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The victim's brother, Tony Rodriguez, identified the woman to ABC News as American citizen Almarosa Tenorio. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR â€œAlmarosa was a very loving daughter, sister, mom and grandmother with a good heart," Rodriguez said in a statement. "Her passion was teaching and working with children. She had a vivacious personality with a smile that would light up a room. We are sad that she was taken from us at such a young age. She will be missed by all that knew her." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tenorio lived with her son, a student at the University of South Alabama, according to a GoFundMe campaign set up for the family. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR No cause of death has been reported, but her death was ruled unnatural, Aruba Public Prosecutor's Office spokeswoman Ann Angela told ABC News. The prosecutor's office will not be releasing the details of the autopsy. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The woman's husband was questioned as a witness and is not being investigated at this time as a suspect, Angela said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Angela said the death is being investigated at every angle but would not disclose whether it's being considered a homicide. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The incident was reported to the FBI and local authorities and the local authorities met and boarded the ship upon arrival in Aruba," Princess Cruises said in a statement Wednesday. "We are cooperating fully with the investigating authorities, including the FBI." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The ship, which can carry up to 3,560 passengers, was expected to return to South Florida on Saturday. The Royal Princess is set to undergo a $15.9 million makeover in just a matter of weeks. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We are deeply saddened by this incident and offer our sincere condolences to the family and those affected," the cruise line said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The woman's name and hometown have not been released. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The death was the second announcement of a person being killed on a cruise ship on Wednesday.
